page.title: List of Full Metal Panic! media

The Second Raid Original Sound Track Album | Type = soundtrack | Artist = [[Toshihiko Sahashi]] | Cover = | Released = 18 August 2005 | Recorded = | Genre = [[Anime soundtrack]] | Length = 44:39 | Label = [[Pony Canyon]] | Producer = [[Takashi Watanabe]] }} {|border="" cellpadding="4" cellspacing="0" style="border: 1px #aaa solid; border-collapse: collapse; padding: 0.2em; margin: 1em 1em 1em 0; background: #f7f8ff; font-size:0.9em;" |- valign="middle" bgcolor="#e6e9ff" !rowspan="2"|# !rowspan="2"|[[English language|English]] Title !colspan="2"|[[Japanese language|Japanese]] Title !rowspan="2"|Time |- bgcolor="#e6e9ff" ![[Kanji]] ![[Romaji]] |- |1. |"Southerly Wind" |åé¢¨ shibuya edit |Minamikaze shibuya edit |2:39 |- |2. |"Shadowy Dealings" |æèº |Anyaku |1:53 |- |3. |"Sprint" |ç¾èµ° |ShissÅ |2:30 |- |4. |"Course Change" |åé¡§ |Kaiko |2:37 |- |5. |"Peace" |å¹³ç© |Heion |1:59 |- |6. |"Friendship and Love" |åæ |YÅ«ai |1:49 |- |7. |"Troubled Mind" |è¦æ© |KunÅ |1:38 |- |8. |"Worries" |æ¸å¿µ |Kennen |2:10 |- |9. |"Tension" |åè¿« |Seppaku |2:32 |- |10. |"Fate" |å®¿å½ |Shukumei |1:38 |- |11. |"Invasion" |ä¾µæ» |ShinkÅ |2:12 |- |12. |"Conflict" |å¯¾å³ |Taiji |2:15 |- |13. |"Command" |æä»¤ |Shirei |2:40 |- |14. |"Strike" |åºæ |Shutsugeki |2:22 |- |15. |"CQC" |æ ¼é |KakutÅ |2:13 |- |16. |"Run" |ç¾é§ |Shikku |2:35 |- |17. |"Counter Strike" |åæ |Hangeki |2:44 |- |18. |"Victory" |åå© |ShÅri |4:10 |- |19. |"I want to see you again" |ããä¸åº¦åã«ä¼ããã ebisu edit |Mouichido Kimi ni Aitai ebisu edit |2:04 |- |} ==Non-Japanese Releases== *[[Europe]]: ADV Films UK released the series on DVD in [[Europe]] in at least two versions, one of them being [[Scandinavia]]n.
Klub Publishing released the first two series on DVD in [[Hungary]]. ==Toys== ===Human figures=== The series has many figures of the various characters. Atelier Sai has produced a blind-box set based on Fumoffu's female characters-a set with guns, and a set from the hot spring. 1/6 and 1/8 scale figures of Tessa and Kaname are available, some of which have removable clothing. ===Arm Slaves=== The series has various action figures of the Arm Slaves. Alter and Aoshima produced 1/48 and 1/35 scale figures of Kurz and Mao's Gernsbacks, the Arbalest and an RK-92 Savage. Kaiyodo introduced the Arbalest and Laevatein into their Revoltech line in 2007 and 2008. In August 2011, Revoltech re-released the Laevatein in a much bigger package which includes the XL-3 flight pack as well. http://www.hlj.com/product/KYD010476 Bandai took it a step further in 2009 by including the Arm Slaves as part of the company's ''Robot Damashii'' (Robot Spirits) line-up, starting with the Arbalest in September 2009. Since then, the firm produced replicas of Kurz and Mao's Gernsbacks, the Falke, desert and urban versions of the Savage AS, the standard and Combat variations of Sousuke's Bonta-kun, the ARX-8 Laevateinhttp://tamashii.jp/item/item.php?eid=01478&pref=500, and the Codarl http://tamashii.jp/item/item.php?eid=01509&pref=500. The XL-2 Emergency jetpack http://p-bandai.jp/tamashiiwebshouten/robotdamashii/item-1000004645/, the mass-produced Combat Bonta-kun (a gray-skinned soldier version that appeared in the ''Fumoffu'' episode ''Fancy without Honor or Humanity'') http://p-bandai.jp/tamashiiwebshouten/robotdamashii/item-1000006115/, a blue-and-white Savage that appeared in the novel ''Burning One-Man Force'' http://p-bandai.jp/tamashiiwebshouten/robotdamashii/item-1000003968/ and the XL-3 flight packhttp://p-bandai.jp/tamashiiwebshouten/robotdamashii/item-1000009493/are limited-edition online exclusives. [[Hobby Japan]] offered the Hiroshi Squadron Gernsback (desert versions featured in the first season's ''Wind Blows at Home'' storyarc) as a mail-order exclusive in its issues from March to April 2010. Dengeki Hobby followed suit with a a weapon set http://tamashii.jp/special/roboarts/diary/detail.php?eid=00210 and a recolored Arbalest that appeared in the first season episode ''Venom's Fire'' (which also had the weapons set bundled in). ==References== {{reflist|2}} {{Full Metal Panic Series}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Full Metal Panic!}} [[Category:Anime soundtracks|Full Metal Panic!]] [[Category:Full Metal Panic!]] [[Category:Film and television discographies]] [[Category:Discographies of Japanese artists]] [[Category:Articles containing Japanese language text]] [[es:Anexo:Episodios de Full Metal Panic!]] [[ru:Ð¡Ð¿Ð¸ÑÐ¾Ðº ÑÐµÑÐ¸Ð¹ Ð°Ð½Ð¸Ð¼Ðµ Â«Ð¡ÑÐ°Ð»ÑÐ½Ð°Ñ ÑÑÐµÐ²Ð¾Ð³Ð°? Ð¤ÑÐ¼Ð¾ÑÑÑÂ»]]
